translated: Om, salutation to the white-souled Bakesha (Lord of Baka), the son of Vasudeva, the destroyer of the demons, the lord of the Vayu (wind) direction.॥1॥ Om, salutation to the marrow-souled white one, the supporter of Rakshasas, the lord of the north-west direction.॥2॥ Om, salutation to the white-souled Bhrkuti-sha (wrinkled-browed one), the son of Vasudeva, the destroyer of the demons, the lord of the north-west direction.॥3॥ Om, Hrau, Ham, salutation to the life-souled Vakulina (one with crooked body), the consort of Lakshmi.॥4॥ Om, Lam, salutation to the power-souled Shiva, the all-pervading one.॥5॥ Om, Ksham, salutation to the self-dissolving Samvartaka (destroyer), the consort of Maya.॥6॥ Om, Hrau, Hrim, having uttered separately, salutation to the head of Isha.॥7॥ Salutation to the face of Tatpurusha, to the heart of Aghora, to the secret part of Vamadeva, and to the form of Sadyojata.
